meanings.definition: A sudden and ignominious failure; a fiasco.
meanings.sent1: The team's performance in the match was a complete debacle.
meanings.sent2: The company's financial debacle led to its closure.
meanings.sent3: The debacle at the talent show left everyone in shock.
meanings.sent4: Her attempt to bake a cake turned into a debacle.
meanings.sent5: The political debacle was all over the news.

meanings.definition: A breaking up of ice in a river.
meanings.sent1: The spring thaw caused a massive debacle on the river.
meanings.sent2: The sound of the debacle echoed through the valley.
meanings.sent3: The debacle of the ice floes created a beautiful sight.
meanings.sent4: The sun's warmth led to the debacle of the frozen river.
meanings.sent5: The noise of the debacle was like music to their ears.

meanings.sent1: The storm caused a debacle in the peaceful town.
meanings.sent2: The unexpected debacle shook the entire neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: The debacle of the protest caught everyone off guard.
meanings.sent4: The loud noise signaled the beginning of the debacle.
meanings.sent5: The debacle of the explosion was felt miles away.
